series.system.estimation.masked.data 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference
  • Articles
    Series system with exponentially distributed component lifetimes Series system with Weibull distributed component lifetimes

    Function reference

    All functions

    dexp_series()
    pdf for exponential series.
    dgeneral_series()
    pdf for general series
    dweibull_series()
    pdf for weibull series
    exp_series_md_1
    Simulated masked data 1
    guo_weibull_series_md
    Real-world masked data. The source is from the paper, "Estimating Component Reliabilities from Incomplete System Failure Data", Table 2 (Example Data for a Series System).
    hazard_exp_series()
    Hazard function for exponential series.
    hazard_general_series()
    Hazard function for general series
    hazard_weibull_series()
    Hazard function for weibull series.
    md_bernoulli_candidate_C1_C2_C3()
    Bernoulli candidate model that is a function of component cause of failure.
    md_info_exp_series_C1_C2_C3()
    Generates the observed information matrix for an exponential series system with respect to parameter theta for masked data with candidate sets that approximately satisfy conditions C1, C2, and C3.
    md_loglike_exp_series_C1_C2_C3()
    Generates a log-likelihood for an exponential series system with respect to parameter theta for masked data with candidate sets that approximately satisfy conditions C1, C2, and C3.
    md_loglike_general_series_C1_C2_C3()
    Masked data approximately satisfies the following set of conditions: C1: Pr(K[i] in C[i]) = 1 C2: Pr(C[i]=c[i] | K[i]=j, T[i]=t[i]) = Pr(C[i]=c[i] | K[i]=j', T[i]=t[i])} for any \code{j,j' in c[i]. C3: masking probabilities are independent of theta
    md_loglike_weibull_series_C1_C2_C3()
    Masked data approximately satisfies the following set of conditions: C1: Pr(K in C) = 1 C2: Pr(C=c | K=j, T=t) = Pr(C=c | K=j', T=t) for any j, j' in c. C3: masking probabilities are independent of theta
    md_mle_series_C1_C2_C3()
    Maximum likelihood estimator of the parameters of a series system given a sample of masked data according to candidate sets that are generated in a way that is compatible with conditions C1, C2, and C3 so that we do not need to know or estimate the distribution of candidate sets.
    md_score_exp_series_C1_C2_C3()
    Generates a score function for an exponential series system with respect to parameter theta for masked data with candidate sets that approximately satisfy conditions C1, C2, and C3.
    md_series_component_failure_decorator_diff()
    Decorate masked data md with a some measure of the difference between component failure probabilities.
    md_series_component_failure_probability_decorator()
    Component failure probability decorator.
    md_series_lifetime()
    Generates failure times and component cause of failure for a series system with the given data frame of component lifetimes encoded by the matrix columns prefixed with t in masked data frame md.
    md_series_lifetime_right_censoring()
    Generates right-censored system failure times s and right-censoring indicators delta for a series system with the given data frame of component lifetimes encoded by the matrix columns prefixed with t
    pexp_series()
    cdf for exponential series.
    pgeneral_series()
    cdf for general series
    pweibull_series()
    The cumulative distribution function for Weibull series
    qexp_series()
    Qunatile function for exponential series.
    qgeneral_series()
    Quantile function (inverse of the cdf) for a general series system. By definition, the quantile p * 100% is the value t that satisfies F(t) - p = 0. We solve for t using Newton's method.
    qweibull_series()
    Quantile function (inverse of the cdf). By definition, the quantile p * 100% for a strictly monotonically increasing cdf F is the value t that satisfies F(t) - p = 0. We solve for t using newton's method.
    rexp_series()
    Survival function for exponential series.
    rgeneral_series()
    Sample from a general series system of m components whose hazard and reliability functions are respectively given by h and R.
    rweibull_series()
    Sampler for weibull series.
    series.system.estimation.masked.data
    series.system.masked.data: A package for estimating series system component lifetime parameters from masked data
    survival_exp_series()
    Survival function for exponential series.
    survival_general_series()
    Survival function for general series
    survival_weibull_series()
    Survival function for weibull series

    Developed by Alexander Towell.
